pageContext.claim: “[Paul Manafort] worked for me for a very short period of time.”
pageContext.analysis: Paul Manafort was hired on March 28, 2016 to manage the campaigns delegate wrangling efforts. He was promoted to campaign chairman and chief strategist on May 19, 2016. (Although, former Trump campaign manager Corey Lewandowski said Manafort was in charge since April 7.) He continued to serve Trump in that capacity through Aug. 19 when he resigned from the campaign. "Short time" might be subjective, but Manafort was a key player in the Trump campaign for the much of the 2016 election.
